content: Am I the only one to notice this trend or is Mil.com under attack? I pose this question in light of the recent "surge" of posters who have joined in the past few days, primarily to post in the "Obama isn't a Natural Born Citizen" type threads as well as thread regarding the Marine who was arrested for threatening President Obama. Most of these posters joined within a couple days, if not hours of each other, and if one pays attention, they all use remarkably similar grammar and syntax. More indicative is the fact that some of these posters have deleted thier profiles as soon as they post one or two posts so they can disappear. I am well aware that a lot of times when something similar happens it's because a featured Mil.com story/article has popped up at the top of a Google search or the like - however most of the threads that I am speaking of were initiated or opened by one of this group themselves , as an attempt to sucker us into it. We've all seen spam attacks before, but this one bears a more worrisome side - it has all the hallmarks of a well organized and dedicated PsyWar/Propaganda operation. When one disappears, another appears, and regardless of which one it is, they can be traced back to the same origin. Some of them even debate amongst themselves - creating false personas with opposing points of view to try and mask what is happening. Even more worrisome is what they are attempting to incite - a large number of them are trying to make it seem as if assassinating a President is ok, and that it would be patriotic to try and overthrow our elected government by force - and coming to our site to try and elicit our own military personnel to do it. We all have differing points of view on a wide range of matters - except one - our loyalty to our country. That's what sets us regular posters apart - that despite our differences, we want to see our nation prosper peacefully. The surge of posters I am referring to on the other hand appear bent on the opposite - inciting civil strive amonst us to aid in their effort to destabilize our government and to use this site to recruit military/former military personnel to aid in that goal.

content: It's a simple matter of angry people with fringe agendas who constantly beat people down with all that nonsense. I saw the beginnings of it before I left the US in 1995. Thirteen years later, those people who were marginalized back then because of their politics and attitude have been legitimized by those who needed their support at the voting booth. The funny thing about all this is that, while their numbers are very small in America as a whole, they have sure made a lot of noise. And it's all about empowering themselves at the expense of every one else - and this country. This phony "tax revolt" nonsense over the past couple of weeks is a perfect example of it. A majority of Americans solidly support the President and his efforts thus far, but these fringe characters would have you believe exactly the opposite. Chuck D once said "Don't believe the hype" - no truer words have been spoken.

content: Am I the only one to notice this trend or is Mil.com under attack? I pose this question in light of the recent "surge" of posters who have joined in the past few days, primarily to post in the "Obama isn't a Natural Born Citizen" type threads as well as thread regarding the Marine who was arrested for threatening President Obama. Most of these posters joined within a couple days, if not hours of each other, and if one pays attention, they all use remarkably similar grammar and syntax. More indicative is the fact that some of these posters have deleted thier profiles as soon as they post one or two posts so they can disappear. I am well aware that a lot of times when something similar happens it's because a featured Mil.com story/article has popped up at the top of a Google search or the like - however most of the threads that I am speaking of were initiated or opened by one of this group themselves , as an attempt to sucker us into it. We've all seen spam attacks before, but this one bears a more worrisome side - it has all the hallmarks of a well organized and dedicated PsyWar/Propaganda operation. When one disappears, another appears, and regardless of which one it is, they can be traced back to the same origin. Some of them even debate amongst themselves - creating false personas with opposing points of view to try and mask what is happening. Even more worrisome is what they are attempting to incite - a large number of them are trying to make it seem as if assassinating a President is ok, and that it would be patriotic to try and overthrow our elected government by force - and coming to our site to try and elicit our own military personnel to do it. We all have differing points of view on a wide range of matters - except one - our loyalty to our country. That's what sets us regular posters apart - that despite our differences, we want to see our nation prosper peacefully. The surge of posters I am referring to on the other hand appear bent on the opposite - inciting civil strive amonst us to aid in their effort to destabilize our government and to use this site to recruit military/former military personnel to aid in that goal.

content: It's a simple matter of angry people with fringe agendas who constantly beat people down with all that nonsense. I saw the beginnings of it before I left the US in 1995. Thirteen years later, those people who were marginalized back then because of their politics and attitude have been legitimized by those who needed their support at the voting booth. The funny thing about all this is that, while their numbers are very small in America as a whole, they have sure made a lot of noise. And it's all about empowering themselves at the expense of every one else - and this country. This phony "tax revolt" nonsense over the past couple of weeks is a perfect example of it. A majority of Americans solidly support the President and his efforts thus far, but these fringe characters would have you believe exactly the opposite. Chuck D once said "Don't believe the hype" - no truer words have been spoken.

content: quote: Originally posted by PhoenixDark: Am I the only one to notice this trend or is Mil.com under attack? I pose this question in light of the recent "surge" of posters who have joined in the past few days, primarily to post in the "Obama isn't a Natural Born Citizen" type threads as well as thread regarding the Marine who was arrested for threatening President Obama. Most of these posters joined within a couple days, if not hours of each other, and if one pays attention, they all use remarkably similar grammar and syntax. More indicative is the fact that some of these posters have deleted thier profiles as soon as they post one or two posts so they can disappear. I am well aware that a lot of times when something similar happens it's because a featured Mil.com story/article has popped up at the top of a Google search or the like - however most of the threads that I am speaking of were initiated or opened by one of this group themselves , as an attempt to sucker us into it. We've all seen spam attacks before, but this one bears a more worrisome side - it has all the hallmarks of a well organized and dedicated PsyWar/Propaganda operation. When one disappears, another appears, and regardless of which one it is, they can be traced back to the same origin. Some of them even debate amongst themselves - creating false personas with opposing points of view to try and mask what is happening. Even more worrisome is what they are attempting to incite - a large number of them are trying to make it seem as if assassinating a President is ok, and that it would be patriotic to try and overthrow our elected government by force - and coming to our site to try and elicit our own military personnel to do it. We all have differing points of view on a wide range of matters - except one - our loyalty to our country. That's what sets us regular posters apart - that despite our differences, we want to see our nation prosper peacefully. The surge of posters I am referring to on the other hand appear bent on the opposite - inciting civil strive amonst us to aid in their effort to destabilize our government and to use this site to recruit military/former military personnel to aid in that goal. Paranoia will destroy ya there PD !
